pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.11: According to SP.2.615 khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.12: For phalāphale see PED, s.v. ā⁴.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.13: According to VIN VN ṭ.1907 uttaribhaṅga is just another word for byañjana: uttaribhaṅgaṁ nāma byañjanaṁ. Byañjana seems to refer to curries apart from the standard bean-curries, which are called sūpa.
